unnormalised: The Income Tax Department conducted raids on multiple locations belonging to prominent businessmen in Mumbai and Delhi on 16/10/2024. Sources within the department revealed that the raids were initiated based on credible information regarding alleged tax evasion under section 276C of the Income Tax Act, 1961. The investigation is focused on uncovering undisclosed income and assets.
normalised: The Income Tax Department conducted raids on multiple locations belonging to prominent businessmen in Mumbai and Delhi on sixteenth October two thousand and twenty four. Sources within the department revealed that the raids were initiated based on credible information regarding alleged tax evasion under section two hundred and seventy six C of the Income Tax Act, one thousand nine hundred and sixty one. The investigation is focused on uncovering undisclosed income and assets.

unnormalised: The raids involved teams of IT officials simultaneously searching residences, offices, and other properties linked to the individuals. Documents, electronic devices, and financial records were seized during the operations. Preliminary estimates suggest potential tax liabilities exceeding Rs. 50 crores, but a comprehensive assessment is still underway.

unnormalised: Advocate Rohan Verma, a tax law expert, commented that the raids indicate a renewed focus on enforcing tax compliance.
